contents.text: oNE YEAR after the fighting started in Ukraine, our worldwide cover reflects on the country’s future. It considers what victory will look like and what it requires.

Leaders: How to win the hot war and the cold war that will follow itBriefing: The war is making Ukraine a Western countryBriefing: The invasion has stalled, but Putin’s war on dissent marches onBriefing: The West is struggling to forge a new arsenal of democracyBriefing: Ukraine’s fate will determine the West’s authority in the worldInternational: The desperate uncertainty of Ukrainian refugees
For subscribers only: to see how we design each week’s cover, sign up to our weekly Cover Story newsletter.
